problem_prompt:
Solve the following problem. When four positive integers are divided by $11$, the remainders are $2,$ $4,$ $6,$ and $8,$ respectively.

When the sum of the four integers is divided by $11$, what is the remainder?
solution:
We can call the four integers in this problem $a,$ $b,$ $c$, and $d$. Then we have \begin{align*}
a &\equiv 2\pmod{11}, \\
b &\equiv 4\pmod{11}, \\
c &\equiv 6\pmod{11}, \\
d &\equiv 8\pmod{11}.
\end{align*}Adding these congruences, we have \begin{align*}
a+b+c+d &\equiv 2+4+6+8 \\
&\equiv 20\pmod{11}.
\end{align*}Therefore, $a+b+c+d$ has the same remainder as $20$ upon division by $11$. This remainder is $\boxed{9}$.
gpt_response:
Let the four positive integers be $a,$ $b,$ $c,$ and $d$. We can express each integer in terms of the remainder when divided by $11$:

$a = 11k + 2$
$b = 11m + 4$
$c = 11n + 6$
$d = 11p + 8$

where $k$, $m$, $n$, and $p$ are integers.

The sum of the four integers is:

$a + b + c + d = (11k + 2) + (11m + 4) + (11n + 6) + (11p + 8) = 11(k + m + n + p) + 20$

Since $k + m + n + p$ is an integer, when the sum of the four integers is divided by $11$, the remainder will be $\boxed{9}$.
